util_pool_async_query
[Pool References]

Functions

void * util_pool_async_query (util_pool_t *pool)

Function Documentation

void* util_pool_async_query ( util_pool_t *  pool  ) 

The util_pool_async_query routine can be used by an application to query for an unused object. If the pool contains at least one object, the object will be removed from the management list and returned by leaving this routine.

NOTE: The operation is not synchronized. There is no guaranty, that the operation will not be interrupted by another process or thread and another object will be inserted at this time. In this case the queue information can be corrupt.

Parameters:
pool Specifies the pool resource.
Returns:
A reference to an object indicates success. NULL indicates an empty pool.
See also:
util_pool_async_insert
